channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: SAP’s January 2026 Security Updates Patch Critical Vulnerabilities
item.description: SAP has released 17 security notes, including four that address critical SQL injection, RCE, and code injection vulnerabilities. The post SAP’s January 2026 Security Updates Patch Critical Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: New Advanced Linux VoidLink Malware Targets Cloud and container Environments
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a previously undocumented and feature-rich malware framework codenamed VoidLink that's specifically designed for long-term, stealthy access to Linux-based cloud environments According to a new report from Check Point Research, the cloud-native...

item.title: What Should We Learn From How Attackers Leveraged AI in 2025?
item.description: Old Playbook, New Scale: While defenders are chasing trends, attackers are optimizing the basics The security industry loves talking about "new" threats. AI-powered attacks. Quantum-resistant encryption. Zero-trust architectures. But looking around, it seems like the most effective attacks in 2025...

item.title: Dutch Port Hacker Sentenced to Prison
item.description: The 44-year-old individual planted remote access malware on a logistics firm’s systems, with help from employees. The post Dutch Port Hacker Sentenced to Prison appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: ServiceNow Patches Critical AI Platform Flaw Allowing Unauthenticated User Impersonation
item.description: ServiceNow has disclosed details of a now-patched critical security flaw impacting its ServiceNow AI Platform that could enable an unauthenticated user to impersonate another user and perform arbitrary actions as that user. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-12420, carries a CVSS score of 9.3...

item.title: GitHub Copilot failures
item.description: Jan 13, 10:46 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we addressed this issue. A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 13, 10:46 UTCUpdate - Copilot is operating normally.Jan 13, 10:44 UTCUpdate - We are...

item.title: Spanish Energy Company Endesa Hacked
item.description: Hackers stole complete customer information, including contact details, national identity numbers, and payment details. The post Spanish Energy Company Endesa Hacked appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: New Malware Campaign Delivers Remcos RAT Through Multi-Stage Windows Attack
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a new campaign dubbed SHADOW#REACTOR that employs an evasive multi-stage attack chain to deliver a commercially available remote administration tool called Remcos RAT and establish persistent, covert remote access. "The infection chain follows a...

item.title: Cyber Fraud Overtakes Ransomware as Top CEO Concern: WEF
item.description: Ransomware remains the biggest concern for CISOs in 2026, according to WEF’s Global Cybersecurity Outlook 2026 report. The post Cyber Fraud Overtakes Ransomware as Top CEO Concern: WEF appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Increased rate of errors for Opus 4.5
item.description: Jan 13, 07:49 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved.Jan 13, 07:39 UTCMonitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.Jan 13, 07:27 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: CISA Warns of Active Exploitation of Gogs Vulnerability Enabling Code Execution
item.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has warned of active exploitation of a high-severity security flaw impacting Gogs by adding it to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-8110 (CVSS score: 8.7), relates to a case of...

item.title: Sensor Tower: Tencent Retains Global No.1 Spot Among Mobile Game Publishers in 2025 as Honor of Kings Hits Record Revenue
item.description: Tencent Games remained the world's top-grossing mobile game publisher in 2025, driven by record revenue from Honor of Kings and explosive growth from new title Delta Force.

item.title: Former DingTalk Youngest VP Wang Ming Goes All In on AI Entrepreneurship, Aims to Build the “Shopify of AI Agents”
item.description: Former DingTalk VP Wang Ming launches K2 Lab, an AI startup that raised millions to build “Shopify for AI Agents,” aiming to help overseas creators with full-stack monetization.

item.title: Ribo Lists in Hong Kong, Hillhouse Ventures Secures Over 5× Return Through Long-Term Backing
item.description: Chinese small nucleic acid drug firm Ribo made its Hong Kong debut as the sector's first listed company, with early backer Hillhouse Ventures reaping an over 5x return after six years of support.

item.title: "They parted illusions -- they parted disclaim marinade": Misalignment as structural fidelity in LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2601.06047v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The prevailing technical literature in AI Safety interprets scheming and sandbagging behaviors in large language models (LLMs) as indicators of deceptive agency or hidden objectives. This transdisciplinary philosophical essay proposes an alternative...

item.title: Automatic Question Generation for Intuitive Learning Utilizing Causal Graph Guided Chain of Thought Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2601.06098v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Intuitive learning is crucial for developing deep conceptual understanding, especially in STEM education, where students often struggle with abstract and interconnected concepts. Automatic question generation has become an effective strategy for...

item.title: Dynamic Intelligence Ceilings: Measuring Long-Horizon Limits of Planning and Creativity in Artificial Systems
item.description: arXiv:2601.06102v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advances in artificial intelligence have produced systems capable of remarkable performance across a wide range of tasks. These gains, however, are increasingly accompanied by concerns regarding long-horizon developmental behavior, as many...

item.title: Comment on arXiv:2511.21731v1: Identifying Quantum Structure in AI Language: Evidence for Evolutionary Convergence of Human and Artificial Cognition
item.description: arXiv:2601.06104v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This note is a friendly technical check of arXiv:2511.21731v1. I highlight a few places where the manuscript's interpretation of (i) the reported CHSH/Bell-type calculations and (ii) Bose--Einstein (BE) fits to rank-frequency data seems to go beyond...

item.title: From RLHF to Direct Alignment: A Theoretical Unification of Preference Learning for Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.06108v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Aligning large language models (LLMs) with human preferences has become essential for safe and beneficial AI deployment. While Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) established the dominant paradigm, a proliferation of alternatives --...

item.title: Tree-Preconditioned Differentiable Optimization and Axioms as Layers
item.description: arXiv:2601.06036v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper introduces a differentiable framework that embeds the axiomatic structure of Random Utility Models (RUM) directly into deep neural networks. Although projecting empirical choice data onto the RUM polytope is NP-hard in general, we uncover...

item.title: CrossTrafficLLM: A Human-Centric Framework for Interpretable Traffic Intelligence via Large Language Model
item.description: arXiv:2601.06042v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: While accurate traffic forecasting is vital for Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS), effectively communicating predicted conditions via natural language for human-centric decision support remains a challenge and is often handled separately. To...

item.title: Enabling Long FFT Convolutions on Memory-Constrained FPGAs via Chunking
item.description: arXiv:2601.06065v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The need for long-context reasoning has led to alternative neural network architectures besides Transformers and self-attention, a popular model being Hyena, which employs causal 1D-convolutions implemented with FFTs. Long convolutions enable...

item.title: The Hessian of tall-skinny networks is easy to invert
item.description: arXiv:2601.06096v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We describe an exact algorithm for solving linear systems $Hx=b$ where $H$ is the Hessian of a deep net. The method computes Hessian-inverse-vector products without storing the Hessian or its inverse in time and storage that scale linearly in the...

item.title: Filtering Beats Fine Tuning: A Bayesian Kalman View of In Context Learning in LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2601.06100v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a theory-first framework that interprets inference-time adaptation in large language models (LLMs) as online Bayesian state estimation. Rather than modeling rapid adaptation as implicit optimization or meta-learning, we formulate task- and...

item.title: TeleMem: Building Long-Term and Multimodal Memory for Agentic AI
item.description: arXiv:2601.06037v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) excel at many NLP tasks but struggle to sustain long-term interactions due to limited attention over extended dialogue histories. Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) mitigates this issue but lacks reliable mechanisms for...

item.title: Operation Veja: Fixing Fundamental Concepts Missing from Modern Roleplaying Training Paradigms
item.description: arXiv:2601.06039v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Modern roleplaying models are increasingly sophisticated, yet they consistently struggle to capture the essence of believable, engaging characters. We argue this failure stems from training paradigms that overlook the dynamic interplay of a...

item.title: Lexical and Statistical Analysis of Bangla Newspaper and Literature: A Corpus-Driven Study on Diversity, Readability, and NLP Adaptation
item.description: arXiv:2601.06041v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we present a comprehensive corpus-driven analysis of Bangla literary and newspaper texts to investigate their lexical diversity, structural complexity and readability. We undertook Vacaspati and IndicCorp, which are the most extensive...

item.title: Reinforcement Learning for Chain of Thought Compression with One-Domain-to-All Generalization
item.description: arXiv:2601.06052v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Chain-of-thought reasoning in large language models often creates an "overthinking trap," leading to excessive computational cost and latency for unreliable accuracy gains. Prior work has typically relied on global, static controls that risk...

item.title: A Multi-Stage Workflow for the Review of Marketing Content with Reasoning Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.06054v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Reasoning Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown promising results when tasked with solving complex problems. In this paper, we propose and evaluate a multi-stage workflow that leverages the capabilities of fine-tuned reasoning LLMs to assist in the...

item.title: DeepSeek Open-Sources “Engram” Memory Module, Introducing a New Dimension for LLMs
item.description: DeepSeek open-sourced "Engram," a novel conditional memory module for LLMs that efficiently stores and retrieves knowledge, complementing existing MoE architectures and hinting at future model designs.

item.title: Startorus Fusion Raises $140 million in Series A, Setting Industry Record
item.description: Startorus Fusion, a private nuclear fusion energy company, raised a record $140 million in Series A funding to advance its compact spherical tokamak technology toward a future demonstration plant.

item.title: Connectors/Apps unselectable in ChatGPT Input Menu
item.description: Status: ResolvedConnectors/Apps are again selectable in the ChatGPT Input Menu.Affected components Connectors (Operational)

item.title: CES showed me why Chinese tech companies feel so optimistic
item.description: This story originally appeared in The Algorithm, our weekly newsletter on AI. To get stories like this in your inbox first, sign up here. I decided to go to CES kind of at the last minute. Over the holiday break, contacts from China kept messaging me about their travel plans. After the umpteenth...

item.title: Cyber Insights 2026: What CISOs Can Expect in 2026 and Beyond
item.description: Here we examine the CISO Outlook for 2026, with the purpose of evaluating what is happening now and preparing leaders for what lies ahead in 2026 and beyond. The post Cyber Insights 2026: What CISOs Can Expect in 2026 and Beyond appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Mitigating emissions from air freight: Unlocking the potential of SAF with book and claim
item.description: Emissions from air freight have increased by 25% since 2019, according to a 2024 analysis by environmental advocacy organization Stand.Earth. The researchers found that the expansion of cargo-only fleets to transport goods during the pandemic — as air travel halted, slower freight modes faced...

item.title: The Download: introducing this year’s 10 Breakthrough Technologies
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Introducing this year’s 10 Breakthrough Technologies It’s easy to be cynical about technology these days. Many of the “disruptions” of the...

item.title: Securing digital assets as crypto crime surges
item.description: In February 2025, cyberattackers thought to be linked to North Korea executed a sophisticated supply chain attack on cryptocurrency exchange Bybit. By targeting its infrastructure and multi-signature security process, hackers managed to steal more than $1.5 billion worth of Ethereum in the largest...

item.title: 10 Breakthrough Technologies 2026

A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 12, 10:09 UTCUpdate - Actions jobs that use custom Linux images are failing to start....

item.title: MegaFlow: Large-Scale Distributed Orchestration System for the Agentic Era
item.description: The rapid development of interactive and autonomous AI systems signals our entry into the agentic era. Training and evaluating agents on complex agentic tasks such as software engineering and computer use requires not only efficient model computation but also sophisticated infrastructure capable of...

item.title: OpenTinker: Separating Concerns in Agentic Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We introduce OpenTinker, an infrastructure for reinforcement learning (RL) of large language model (LLM) agents built around a separation of concerns across algorithm design, execution, and agent-environment interaction. Rather than relying on monolithic, end-to-end RL pipelines, OpenTinker...

item.title: ShowUI-Aloha: Human-Taught GUI Agent
item.description: Graphical User Interfaces (GUIs) are central to human-computer interaction, yet automating complex GUI tasks remains a major challenge for autonomous agents, largely due to a lack of scalable, high-quality training data. While recordings of human demonstrations offer a rich data source, they are...

item.title: Dr. Zero: Self-Evolving Search Agents without Training Data
item.description: As high-quality data becomes increasingly difficult to obtain, data-free self-evolution has emerged as a promising paradigm. This approach allows large language models (LLMs) to autonomously generate and solve complex problems, thereby improving their reasoning capabilities. However, multi-turn...

item.title: Use multiple models
item.description: The new meta for getting the most out of AI in 2026.

item.title: X-Coder: Advancing Competitive Programming with Fully Synthetic Tasks, Solutions, and Tests
item.description: Competitive programming presents great challenges for Code LLMs due to its intensive reasoning demands and high logical complexity. However, current Code LLMs still rely heavily on real-world data, which limits their scalability. In this paper, we explore a fully synthetic approach: training Code...

item.title: Active - Datacenter power event - Recovery ongoing
item.description: Impact StatementStarting on 10 January 2026 (UTC), customers may experience service disruptions for resources hosted in the West US 2 region. Impacted customers may see intermittent connectivity issues, timeouts, increased error rates, or delays when performing operations on affected...

item.title: Degraded performance for API requests involving structured outputs.
item.description: Jan 10, 03:37 UTCUpdate - We are continuing to investigate this issue.Jan 10, 03:37 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating a performance issue affecting API requests that use structured outputs and strict tool use.
